intro: Centromadia parryi, commonly known as the Parry's centromadia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal practices. Centromadia parryi thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
